The port on which to open the Beverly index metadata construction service.
AD.name: getIndexingMetadata-port
solr-datastream
AD.description: The ID of a Fedora datastream for manual override of the index metadata construction. If this datastream is present in an indexable object, the Solr document for transmission to the index will be taken directly from it, instead of being dynamically constructed.

AD.name: fedora-api-m-queue-name
AD.description: The name of the JMS queue on which to listen for Fedora update events.

AD.name: fedoraUsername
AD.description: The name of the user as whom to use API-M against the repositories. API-M is only exercised when an indexer object is purged, at which point all objects containing references to it are stripped of those references to maintain the integrity of the index configuration graph.

AD.name: fedoraPassword
AD.description: For use with the fedoraUsername setting. If you secure the link between Karaf and Fedora's Webservices by other means, you can avoid using this setting.

AD.name: xmlTypes
AD.description: MIMEtypes that will not be passed through Tika parsing prior to XSLT execution.

AD.name: solr-http-timeout
AD.description: Time to wait for Solr index server to respond to messages.
